intro: Linaria cardonica, commonly known as the Crimean toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous regions. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers with four petals. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it is known for its ability to thrive in poor, well-drained soils. Linaria cardonica is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
